p:
HRTEM was carried out on an FEI Tecnai F30 G 2 STwin microscope (FEG, 300 kV, spherical aberration C S = 1.2 mm) and low-resolution scanning transmission electron microscopy (STEM) imaging on a TITAN 80-300 (image corrector). Precession electron diffraction (PED) was conducted on a Philips CM 30 ST microscope (LaB 6, 300 kV) equipped with a spinning star device (NanoMEGAS). HRTEM micrographs were obtained by tilting the individual specimens into the
zone-axis orientation, which allowed for visualizing planar defects without superposition.
